's okay, Tom," Mia said softly. "I'm here now." Mia gently patted Tom's back, and he stopped crying. Mia felt happy and not fearful anymore. She knew she was a good big sister. From that day on, Mia always peeked in on Tom to make sure he was okay. And they lived happily ever after.

! I have a passport! I am going on a big trip!" Sam looked at the passport and said, "Wow, Tim! That is so cool! Can I hold it?" Tim trusted Sam, so he let him hold the passport.
But Sam was not careful. He lost the passport while they were playing. Tim was very sad and worried. When his dad found out, he was not happy. They could not go on their big trip because they needed the passport. The moral of the story is to be careful with important things and not to show off.

something we can do to make the park better for everyone?” Timmy thought and then he had an idea.
He said, “Can we raise money to buy a new slide for the park? That would make all the children happy!”
His mom smiled and said yes. And so Timmy and his mom started a fundraiser to buy a new slide for the park. And when it was over the park was much more fun and the children were very happy. 
The moral of the story is to lift each other up, and with the right effort we can make big changes together.

Mia asked her mom, "Can I open the big box?" Her mom said, "No, Mia. We do not know what is inside. It could be something bad." Mia was sad but she listened to her mom.

"Look, Lila, I found a big shell!" Sam said, holding up a shiny pink shell. "It is so pretty and smooth. I value it a lot. Do you want to see?"
"Yes, please!" Lila said, running over to Sam. She took the shell and looked at it closely. "Wow, it is incredible! Can I keep it?"
Sam thought for a moment. He liked the shell too, but he liked Lila more. He wanted to make her happy. He nodded and smiled. "Sure, you can keep it. It is a gift for you."

so he thought, "I will eat this jelly all by myself!" Tom took the bowl to his favorite spot under the sun to enjoy his treat.
As Tom started to eat the jelly, his friend, a small bird named Sue, flew by. Sue saw the jelly and asked, "Can I have some jelly too?" Tom said, "No, this is my jelly. I found it first!" Sue felt sad and flew away.
The sun was very hot that day, and soon, Tom's jelly started to melt. It became a big, sticky mess. Tom was sad because he could not eat the jelly anymore.

. Tim's mom said, "Be careful, the pizza is fragile." Tim tried to be careful, but he tripped and the pizza flew into the air. The pizza fell apart and the pieces scatter all over the floor. Tim was sad.
Just then, their dog, Spot, came running in. Spot saw the pizza on the floor and began to eat it. Tim's mom laughed and said, "Don't worry, Tim. We can make another pizza, and Spot can have this one." Tim smiled, and they all had a fun time making and eating pizza together.
